intro: Pabstiella lacerticeps, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The plant typically grows from a bulbous stem and produces narrow, grass-like leaves adapted to conserve water. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. Pabstiella lacerticeps is well-suited to harsh environments and plays a role in stabilizing desert soils.
